screen1Body.value: Although arteriovenous fistulas (AVF) are the gold standard lifeline for dialysis patients, their creation may be associated with local and systemic complications. Up to 25% of AVFs develop high flow (1) of over 1,500 ml/min, more than 30% develop severe aneurysm and 10% suffer from hand-ischemia due to steal syndrome. Multiple studies demonstrated the toxic effects of high flow rates, including, high output cardiac failure, pulmonary hypertension, hand ischemia and aneurysmal degeneration of the AVF (2). To date, there is no effective solution for long term, stable modulation of flows to treat complications associated with AVF.

screen1Footnote2.value: KDOQI Clinical Practice Guideline for Vascular Access;2018.

screen7Bullet2.value: Simple to apply without affecting standard practice

screen7Bullet3.value: Can be cut to perfectly fit the vein
